info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Columbia, southeastern Albany and northeastern Greene Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Feura Bush, or 8 miles southwest of Delmar, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Baltimore, Ravena, Coxsackie, Coeymans, Stuyvesant, Clarksville, Coeymans Hollow, West Coxsackie, Spawn Hollow, Dormansville, Callanans Corners, Keefers Corners, Earlton, Otter Hook, Limestreet, Climax, Bethlehem Heights, Hannacroix, Poolsburg and South Bethlehem. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 21B and 21A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
